ai-patthana22.28:0.2_0: under the influence of the Dhamma: the Protector of the Three Worlds
ai-patthana22.28:0.3_0: wrapped in what is the cause of poison, and so on is the reason for the sake of the eyes.
ai-patthana22.28:1.1_0: One should not give rise to the cause of not-self. Understanding the conditions for the associated with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.28:1.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:2.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to unpervading the cause or reason for doing so. The causes of trouble gives rise to the repulsion of causes.
ai-patthana22.28:2.1_1: the section on the same cause,
ai-patthana22.28:3.1_0: Not for the sake of not grasping, nor for the sake of resentment, because of the cause or reason, there is no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.28:3.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:4.1_0: It’s not because of disrespect, because of not impingement, nor because of that.
ai-patthana22.28:4.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:5.1_0: Not for the sake of the donor, and not for the sake of non-greed, nor for the sake of repulsion, by cause or reason.
ai-patthana22.28:5.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:6.1_0: It’s not because of lack of intenseating the cause or condition. For this reason it doesn’t give rise to cause or reason for these reasons.
ai-patthana22.28:6.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:7.1_0: Not for the sake of resentment, not for the sake of subsistance, for the sake of non-existence, not for the sake of livelihood; and for the sake of this because of cause.
ai-patthana22.28:7.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.28:8.1_0: Not for the sake of livelihood, nor for the sake of resentment, or for the sake of function, nor for the sake of repulsion, because of causes and reasons.
